intro: Thrincia maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan thrincia, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional herbal remedies. Thrincia maroccana thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
